title: 111_s1520
content: CHAPTER 1504 - NATIONAL AMERICAN INDIAN VETERANS, INCORPORATED: This section recognizes National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated as a corporation and grants them a federal charter under Part B of subtitle II of title 36, United States Code. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is a federally chartered nonprofit corporation with purposes outlined in its articles of incorporation, constitution, and bylaws, including upholding and defending the Constitution of the United States. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated commits to upholding the Constitution of the United States, uniting all American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, advocating for their welfare regardless of service period, and promoting social welfare in the US. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated aims to advocate for the needs of American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, promote research on their relationship with American society, and provide technical assistance to regions without veterans committees. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated aims to advocate for the needs of American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans by providing outreach services, training Tribal Veterans Service Officers, determining membership eligibility, defining the board of directors' responsibilities, and outlining officer roles and elections. The officers of the corporation are elected as per the constitution and bylaws, with no discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, handicap, or age. The corporation's powers are limited to those granted by its articles of incorporation and must conform to the laws of the jurisdiction. The corporation has exclusive rights to its name, seals, emblems, and badges. The corporation has exclusive rights to use specific names, seals, emblems, and badges. It is restricted from issuing stock, paying dividends, or distributing income or assets to members, officers, or directors. The corporation is prohibited from distributing income or assets to members, officers, or directors during the charter's lifespan. Reasonable compensation and expense reimbursement for officers are allowed. Loans to any officer, director, member, or employee are not permitted. The corporation cannot claim congressional approval for its activities. It must maintain its tax-exempt status as per the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The corporation must maintain its tax-exempt status as per the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It is required to keep correct and complete books, minutes of proceedings, and a record of members with voting rights. All books and records can be inspected by members or their representatives for a proper purpose at any reasonable time. The corporation must comply with laws regarding service of process and liability for acts of officers and agents. Failure to comply with requirements may result in consequences. The corporation must comply with laws regarding service of process and liability for acts of officers and agents. Failure to comply with requirements, including maintaining tax-exempt status, will result in the expiration of the charter granted by this chapter. The corporation is also required to submit an annual report to Congress on its activities, which is not made public. No annual report under this section shall be printed as a public document. National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is referenced in section 1504 as "150401".
